intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. margaritae, commonly known as the marguerite daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with silvery-white petals surrounding a yellow central disk. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate and cheerful presence to gardens.
